Reviews.Content: It was Acceptable........ The hotel is very close to the train station which is great considering you don't want to drag you luggage through Florence. The elevator was very small, but like many other ones I've seen in Italy. Our room was adequate and actually pretty cute and the staff were very nice and helpful. The only problems that I had with the place were that they don't turn the heat on until the end of October and it kind of smelled like a bar in the hallway because the people at the front desk sat and chainsmoked in the breakfast room. It will fit your needs and price range if you're not looking for anything fancy, but I think there are a lot of places in Florence that would do the same.
Reviews.Author: ShawneeK1

Reviews.Content: perfectly serviceable hotel Location is good (walking distance to train station). Any site in Fiorenze is easily walkable from this hotel. Rooms are utterly adequate, but with tiny showers. Street outside can be noisy. There is a laptop in the room and Internet access is cheap (6 euros a day) BUT they require that the Internet fee be paid in cash separate from your bill. This is a huge but, so pay attention. If you budget, like we did, to have just have enough cash for the taxi ride to the airport, you might get in trouble. Like we did. So bring enough cash.
Reviews.Author: carleric

Reviews.Content: Reasonable hotel, good location We were pleased to arrive to find the hotel so close to the train station which made us closeby to the main sites in Florence and it was easy for daytrips out of Florence. The reception and room itself was slightly disappointing. It was traditional decor but the bathroom was fairly run down with leaking taps and toliet. Having seen into a couple of the rooms there were nicer ones than ours so it might be worth asking to move if you get the room with the very noisy toilet flushing system! Otherwise, staff were helpful and there was a nice breakfast room with a reasonable selection. We paid what we thought was a fairly high rate for an average hotel but didn't by any means ruin a fantastic break in florence.
Reviews.Author: ClaireLLondon

Reviews.Content: Loved my room       ceiling
Reviews.Author: happy_girl_one

Reviews.Content: Not quite good enough Our room was fine although a bit noisy overlooking a service area where someone seemed to be throwing bottles into a recycling bin every night very late. Troubled by mossies. Breakfast was very poor, we have no expectation greater than a decent coffee and a pastry of some sort, given this is Italy the coffee was dreadful and dispensed from a vending machine. We only tried it once and preferred finding somewhere out.Good location being so close to the rail station and coach drop from Pisa airport
Reviews.Author: Gdoc

Reviews.Content: Best Hotel!       wardrobe  balcony
Reviews.Author: Bellecarte

Reviews.Content: ok stay if you are coming by train My husabnd and I stayed at this hotel fro 3 nights in June. It was ok, but nothing to brag about. First of all, don't stay here if you have a car! Book somewhere with parking. The location would have been great if we were coming by train though. But, there is no parking, the staff did not understand/speak enough English to suggest where to park, so we parked at the train station and ended up paying over 60 euros per night for parking. I was hoping for a quaint hotel, and this was not it. This hotel is actually one floor of a building which on each floor of the building there is another hotel or a business. The breakfast was fair. We were able to walk everywhere during the day, so the location is good (you don't need a car in Florence). The room was nice and clean and the bathroom was fine as well. A nice touch was the lap top in the room which allowed for cheap internet use.
Reviews.Author: canadian_rensky

Reviews.Content: Good Value, Convenient and Comfortable! Our family of four stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in early June 2007 (booked direct with hotel). We were quite satisfied with our stay. The room was large, the beds were comfortable, and it was clean. Sheets,  towels provided. The A/C worked well. The breakfast room is very charming with a pretty view outside, and the buffet is decent. The front desk people were friendly and helpful, providing maps, directions, etc. The decor was a little worn in our particular room, but still gracious, and I noticed some even prettier rooms near ours (the doubles).Our bidet had a slow leak at the floor base which was the only item of annoyance, but no big deal really. Also, there is a little bit of street noise, but mostly during the rush hour times, not noticable by us at night. I honestly don't think there would be many places in this price range (if any) where you could avoid all street noise, as Florence is pretty concentrated and busy with motorcycles and cars. We felt that the price was very good (130 eu/nt for 4 people incl. breakfast) for what we received. The hotel is only 5-8 minutes walking from the train station. We could walk to all the major sites, though it might take 20 minutes or so to reach the farthest ones. There's lots to see along the way, so it's a good way to see the city. We would definately consider staying at this hotel in the future.
Reviews.Author: greeny-7

Reviews.Content: Hotel Desiree is wonderful! My daughter and I just returned from two weeks in Italy. After staying in three and four star hotels, which are nice but devoid of personality, we were completely chamed by the Hotel Desiree in Florence. The room was large, homey, spotless and included a balcony. Yes, you could hear the slight clatter of breakfast being prepared down the hall -- but it did not disturb our sleep. The breakfast room is delightful. Food is good. The staff is very nice and accommodating. Location is great. A great value and a wonderful experience.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: noisy The hotel was reasonably priced, very clean and the room spacious and initially impressive. However, the rooms at the front of the hotel on the busy street are incredibly noisy even with ear plugs. The noise of buses, very heavy goods vehicles and dustcarts truly is intolerable. They run throughout the night as the front of the hotel faces the bus station. Bangkok is quieter! Had I not paid for four nights in advance I would have checked out. If you can ensure you get a room at the back of the hotel I am sure you will enjoy your stay as it's in a good location and the staff are pleasant and the breakfast room is really lovely with a beautiful view across the terracotta rooftops.
Reviews.Author: Pressgirl

Reviews.Content: Great bargain I stayed at the Hotel Desiree in November 2002 and was very pleased. In the off season, it is not just a good deal, but a great deal--in 2005, 65 euros for a double. The hotel is very close to the train station, but unlike some cities, this seemed to me a good thing in Florence--convenient, and the neighborhood didn't seem shady to me. It was a very easy walk to the Duomo and the other major sights. Most of all, I was pleased by the charm of our room. Painted furniture, high ceilings, huge stained glass windows, patterned tile floors. We were on the street, but the enormous wooden shutters you can see in the pictures on the website actually close, giving you a double layer of insulation--I didn't have any problem with the noise. For the money, I thought it was a lovely room--better than I have typically done in major European cities on a budget.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Nice The location is great, it's just around the corner of the railway station. Less than 5 min walk. It is on 3rd floor of a very old building which has a very traditional elevator. It looks like being renovated recently since everything is quite clean. I booked via venere  the hotel is just looked like the photos on the web. I got a very spacious room facing the back side, so it's quiet as well. I agree that if your room is facing the street side, it may be quite noisy (I had that experience when staying in a hotel in Rome).I have met several receptions. All of them speak very good English and are very nice as well. When we firstly arrive, the reception give me map and detailed direction and being patient in answering all our questions.The bathroom is just like all others' review. You may get your room flood when you have shower, which I found it is quite common in hotel in Italy. But if you can get a very good shower when the strong water.
Reviews.Author: bearbear

Reviews.Content: good value good value for small hotel.single room small and as it overlooked central well was rather gloomy. however it was perfectly adeqaute with new furniture and recently revamped bathroom which altho small was ok. usual central drain shower which , despite folding door, made all floor very wet, careful sequencing of washing could avoid this.! plus point good thick towels.good continental breakfast.pleasant staff and nice feel to place. a good value hotel in a not great location.however would use again.
Reviews.Author: ashlea

Reviews.Content: Good Hotel ~ Shame about the noise. The staff were very helpful, I needed to see a Dr and the receptionist made the appointment for me and ensured I knew where the surgery was.Our room was a good size, but we did manage to flood the bathroom everytime we had a shower, the shower cubicle was damaged.Unfortunately, our room overlooked the road, it was very noisy at night, buses appeared to run all night and the local scooter group seemed to race on the road at any time. The bins were even emptied at 4.00 am.If you could be guaranteed a room off the road the hotel would be a good place to stay, however if there isn't a guarantee you will need to take ear plugs with you to get a decent nights sleep.
Reviews.Author: JHB2B

Reviews.Content: Good Value for a 3* hotel in Florence I agree with all the reviews except for Disappointed, which was unfortunate. The owner's wife speaks the best english and understands your English, so she's the one to talk to if you have problems.Our family of seven stayed there for 5 nights taking three rooms. The single smelled of sewage, and was incredibly small (as most singles tend to be) so my niece was moved to another room the next day.We've traveled extensively so understand, most rooms in Europe are smaller than American's are used to. Being a three star hotel, you can't expect the spacious lobby/bar/reception area that you'd have at a more expensive hotel.As mentioned, this hotel is on the second (read 3rd in English, the 1st floor bing the ground floor). The elevator is large enough for your suitcases, and you walk up the flights - great for your buns!For some reason in Florence, most bathrooms have a drain in the floor and the shower is rather open - meaning, it's going to get the entire bathroom wet, usually.The foursome had the corner room which was large. Their bath had a 'fixed' shower that did not get water all over. Our niece was moved to the room next to them, again larger than most, but she had the 'fold-up' shower as did we. Out room was down the hall across from reception, and definitely the most beautiful with stained glass window and gorgeous furniture.All rooms had windows you could open to the street. In the quad, there were two windows which created a nice cross draft when you didn't want air condition. Both the corner room and the next to it were bothered by revelers in the street one night. Our room remained quiet.We found the staff to be most helpful and cordial, although their English wa s limited. We especailly liked the cheery breakfast room with morning sunlight and a flower draped balcony. The staff worked to keep the tables cleared and provide hot coffee/tea/rolls/cereal - the usual for Europe.The location was good, very close to the train station which we used and the bus which we took up to the Piazza Michaelangelo. Florence is small and walkable so bring good shoes.The owner suggested Za-Za's in the Piazza Mercado. That and the restaurant next to it were the best we dined at in Florence. Other than baths which are all tight quarters in Florence, we found this hotel a bargain for location and price. American's should know that many european hotels do not furnish washcloths, so bring you own if you object to using a small towel.
Reviews.Author: wagasa

Reviews.Content: Large Room, but the shower... The room was large, but the bathroom was small and the shower was just a showerhead coming out of the wall with a curtain. If you showered, the entire bathroom floor was flooded. The staff was nice, but it's located right near the train station so its a bit shady. We found the location to be inconvenient from where we wanted to hang out.
Reviews.Author: yimicat

Reviews.Content: Good Value We stayed at this hotel on September 7, 2004. It was a great hotel and very pretty. The rooms were spacious, but the bathrooms quite small (depending on your room). It is on a loud street so you have to keep your window closed, but there is air conditioning. It had a TV, private bathroom, and a lovely breakfast room. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I would definately stay at this hotel again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Good overall Met my expectations, convenient location. The two better aspects were the good buffet breakfast (served in a very nice sunny room) and the very wide quiet halls in which comfortable couches are placed. This was great for reading or chatting when waiting for people that are catching a little extra sleep, or have the air conditioning up too high for your comfort. On a quiet street (3rd floor) yet truly just a block from the train station. (Nearby recommended restaurant is La Grotta Di Leo). I would recommend this hotel if booked at a moderate rate (we paid 120 E for a quad).
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great location, not bad hotel This hotel is literally 500 metres from the Central railway station and you walk quite easily from the hotel to most of the main tourist attractions in Florence. It is situated in a large building with a number of other hotels, each one occupying one or two floors (there is a lift). The room was large and spacious. The bathroom was poorly designed with the toilet almost on top of an open, wet shower. The street is noisy so you have to have to keep the window closed to keep out the noise but you are in the middle of the city. There is air conditioning and the breakfast is adequate - typical Italian breakfast with lots of breads and sweet cakes. The staff were okay. Maybe as a result of the language barrier they did not appear overly friendly or helpful. They really could make a difference by being more pleasant and willing to provide tourist advice.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Good Location!! This hotel is definitely a budget hotel. Our room was nice and had a view however I thought it could have been cleaner. After staying in 5 other hotels in Italy in the same price range this hotel was the most disappointing. The air conditioning worked very well and we found it quiet. The breakfast was very good and the staff friendly. It is in an excellent location as we came to Florence by train and walked to the hotel. Also close to everything else.
Reviews.Author: Darmark

Reviews.Content: Dissapointed I was very dissapointed at the hotel first of all because it was a misunderstanding about my reservation. They treated me like I wanted to rob them and like I have not dignity and integrity. I was very offended because they don't let me explain what was going on and again they don't realized that I was able to pay what they were asking for...I made a trip to Europe and it wasn't exactly a lotto I have the money to travel, it was just that the reservation was made wrong and not even by me but the travel agency. They don't apologized and not even made an effort to understand and listen. It was the negative aspect about my trip to Florence. I know there are other hotels there that have people that treat others with respect and dignity. I won't ever go back there or recommend it to anyone.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Lovely, but... Hotel Desiree was lovely, spacious, and clean. Breakfast was more than adequate, and the location was convient. Unfortunately, the neighborhood was not as good as some, and the street was incredibly noisy! I would recommend the hotel, especially for the price, with one caveat: make sure they give you a room in the back, and not on the street!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: *Loved* Hotel Desiree I must write to say that my stay at the Hotel Desiree was unforgettable! There are not enough words to describe the very helpful and kind gentleman who greeted us every night and helped us with all our requests. He was more than patient with us, even though we couldn'tspeak much Italian, and he just enough English. I have recommended this hotel to my friends, and hope they'll spread the word. The juices and croissants are made fresh every morning, so you get to wake up to the smells of home. Although, if you are American, our bathroom was kinda small, but the bedroom was huge. Very wonderful over all. I will be staying here again when I go back to Florence. So convenient to everything!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
